newsitem.title: USA: US securities bill problems solved - Senate aide.
newsitem.headline: US securities bill problems solved - Senate aide.

text.p: A spokesman for the Senate Banking Committee said Monday that there were no known problems in the way of Senate passage of a major securities bill.
"The problems have all been worked out," spokesman Rich Mills said. He added that the bill's sponsors were ready to bring it before the Senate under a procedure requiring unanimous consent.
He was responding to a comment earlier by Senate Democratic Leader Tom Daschle that he understood there might be some problems with the bill because of objections in the Senate.
Senate Republican Leader Trent Lott told reporters he thought all problems with the bill had been worked out, although he had not checked.
Daschle, in a closed-door meeting with Senate Democrats, was not immediately available for further comment.
Among other things, the bill would overhaul regulation of mutual funds and give the Securities and Exchange Commission $20 million additional funding to supervise investment advisers.
